Content.Name: Inaugural Program
Content.Title: Inaugural Program
Content.Abstract: A record of the program carried out during President Kim B. Clark's inauguration.
Content.BodyCopy:
Tuesday, October 11, 2:00 p.m. 
Brigham Young University–Idaho, Hart Auditorium

PRESIDING:
Gordon B. Hinckley
President of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Brigham Young University–Idaho

CONDUCTING:
President Gordon B. Hinckley

PRELUDE AND POSTLUDE:
Brigham Young University–Idaho Symphony Orchestra

ACADEMIC PROCESSIONAL:
Brigham Young University–Idaho Symphony Orchestra
"Procession of the Nobles" from Mlada 
Composed by Nicholas Rimsky-Korsakov
R. Kevin Call, Conductor

(The audience will please stand during the processional and remain standing during the presentation of colors and the National Anthem)

POSTING OF COLORS:
Presented by Brigham Young University–Idaho R.O.T.C.

NATIONAL ANTHEM:
Brigham Young University–Idaho Combined Choirs
and Symphony Orchestra
R. Kevin Call, Conductor

INVOCATION:
Elder Richard G. Scott 
Member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles 
and Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees

WELCOME & ACKNOWLEDGMENTS:
President Gordon B. Hinckley

GREETINGS TO THE PRESIDENT:
Ammon Fife
Student Body President

Joe Marsden
President of BYU–Idaho/Ricks College Alumni Association

David Ward
President of BYU–Idaho Faculty Association

Dirk Kempthorne
Governor of the State of Idaho

REMARKS:
Lawrence H. Summers
President of Harvard University

Elder W. Rolfe Kerr
Member of the First Quorum of the Seventy 
and Commissioner of the Church Educational System

MUSICAL SELECTION:
Brigham Young University–Idaho Combined Choirs 
and Symphony Orchestra
"Praise to the Lord, the Almighty"
Arranged by Mack Wilberg
Kevin Brower, Conductor

INSTALLATION AND CHARGE 
TO THE PRESIDENT:
President Gordon B. Hinckley

RESPONSE:
Dr. Kim B. Clark
Fifteenth President of Brigham Young University–Idaho

REMARKS: 
President Gordon B. Hinckley

BENEDICTION: 
Sister Bonnie D. Parkin
Member of the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees

RECESSIONAL: 
Brigham Young University–Idaho Symphony Orchestra
